instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1425: What is A1425? A1425 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Early 2013, Late 2012 with EMC 2672, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3190, 820-3462..

threads.title: 820 3676, No bklt ,no liquid damage
threads.message:
Hey, 

No backlight, 

<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> 3.3V and the gate off of <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> is not being pulled low. I've replaced <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7700</TRANSISTOR> still doesn't work.. IDEAS?? 

ty

threads.title: 820 3676, No bklt ,no liquid damage
threads.message: Is there even an image? Known good LCD for 2013 model? <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high? PRAM reset?

threads.title: 820 3676, No bklt ,no liquid damage
threads.message:
yes i can see a logo Apple and in external monitor work's too.. unfortunately i don't have a LCD for 2013, in the moment only have LCD for board 820 3462..  

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> - 3.3V and i already do a PRAM reset!  

Duke a quick question, LCD compatible for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>?? only works with 2015 LCD?? thank you

threads.title: 820 3676, No bklt ,no liquid damage
threads.message:
No 2015 is different!

<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1425</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD will work for testing.

threads.title: 820 3676, No bklt ,no liquid damage
threads.message: same think apple logo but no bklt. pin 3&4 = 0.473v with flat cable connect and 0.175v without flat cable.

threads.title: 820 3676, No bklt ,no liquid damage
threads.message: pin 3 and 4 on the LCD connector should be pulled up to 5V. Probably corroded traces.

threads.title: 820 3676, No bklt ,no liquid damage
threads.message: Pin 3 = 4.8V and pin 4 = 5.1V.. not easy to find this problem.. i need to wait for a good screen to exclude that..
